member.name: T:BrakelInlogApplication.Building
member.summary: Class that represents a building/location in the system

member.name: P:BrakelInlogApplication.Building.BuildingID
member.summary: The building id used to identify the building

member.name: P:BrakelInlogApplication.Building.AccessRole
member.summary: The access role of the user in this building

member.name: T:BrakelInlogApplication.AccessRole
member.summary: Enum for the different access roles

member.name: F:BrakelInlogApplication.AccessRole.Administrator
member.summary: Administrators have full access to the building, in read and edit mode.

member.name: F:BrakelInlogApplication.AccessRole.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly users can only read the sensor results, but can not make changes

member.name: F:BrakelInlogApplication.AccessRole.None
member.summary: None means the user has no rights in this building, buildings with these rights should not be shown in the list

member.name: T:BrakelInlogApplication.ConstantHelper
member.summary: Helper class that wraps around the .NET ConfigurationManager and provides easier access

member.name: P:BrakelInlogApplication.ConstantHelper.ConnectionString
member.summary: The connectionstring for the datasource provider

member.name: T:BrakelInlogApplication.Changes
member.summary: Class used for taking actions with groups

member.name: P:BrakelInlogApplication.Changes.GroupID
member.summary: The group id this change will affect

member.name: P:BrakelInlogApplication.Changes.ChangeValue
member.summary: The value the group will be changed to

member.name: P:BrakelInlogApplication.Changes.ChangeStatus
member.summary: Status boolean, null for new, true if success, false if failed

member.name: T:BrakelInlogApplication.APIException
member.summary: The APIException is used to indicate a certain argument does not meet API definition in term of formatting, it's actual value is not evaluated.

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.APIException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.ArgumentException class.

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.APIException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.ArgumentException class with a specified error message.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.APIException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.ArgumentException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.APIException.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.ArgumentException class with a specified error message and the name of the parameter that causes this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The name of the parameter that caused the current exception.

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.APIException.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the System.ArgumentException class with a specified error message, the parameter name, and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The name of the parameter that caused the current exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

member.name: T:BrakelInlogApplication.API
member.summary: Entrypoint for the Async handler

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.API.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor, this will only be called once (Singleton behaviour)

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.API.BeginProcessRequest(System.Web.HttpContext,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Entrypoint for the request handeling (Called by the ASP.NET runtime, do not invoke manually!)

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.API.EndProcessRequest(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Exit point for the request handeling, all cleanup code should go here (Called by the ASP.NET runtime, do not invoke manually!)

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.API.ProcessRequest(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: Old style entry point for handlers, should not be used.

member.name: P:BrakelInlogApplication.API.IsReusable
member.summary: Boolean to indicate the handler is reusable which causes Singleton like behaviour (Performance tweak)

member.name: T:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation
member.summary: Handler class used to handle the async requests

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation.#ctor(System.AsyncCallback,System.Web.HttpContext,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor (Called in BeginProcessRequest, do not invoke manually!)

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation.StartAsyncWork
member.summary: Method to start the async task

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation.StartAsyncTask(System.Object)
member.summary: Internal handler method that handles the request

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation.login(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates the user's credentials and returns a token that will be used to validate other requests
member.returns: A token not equal to all 0 on succes, a token of all 0 on failure

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation.getBuildings(System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns a list of buildngs which the current user can see, and the permissions he has in those buildings

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation.makeChangesToGroups(System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.List{BrakelInlogApplication.Changes})
member.summary: Method to iniate making changes to groups
member.param: The building id for the building in which the groups are
The list of changes you want to commit
member.returns: The list of changes with a boolean value to indicate succes of the operation per change

member.name: M:BrakelInlogApplication.AsynchOperation.getUserLayout(System.Guid,System.Guid)
member.summary: Get the current user's screen layout for the selected building
member.param: The building for which you want the layout
member.returns: A string representation of the XML, which describes the layout of the application
